name: recirculate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to go around or through something again, or to make something go around or through something again, for a second, third, etc. time: Society recirculates money through taxation and through individual wealth. Her low blood pressure has to do with the blood re-circulating after the surgical procedure.
More examplesFewer examplesThe building had a recirculating air system.I wanted to extend these stories and re-circulate them.We had to get up and walk around to recirculate the blood.The fatal flaw in capitalism is that it gathers wealth at the top over time without recirculating it.
